alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 9:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Texas, including the following counties, Brewster, Pecos and Terrell. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rainfall is possible this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Magoy Creek, Sanderson Canyon, Cedar Creek, Prairie Creek, Pyle Draw, Cow Creek, Cook Creek, Thurston Canyon, Downie Draw, Garcia Creek, Big Canyon, Indian Creek, Maxon Creek, Fresno Creek, Grande, Rio, Pony Creek, Buena Creek, Dry Creek, Candilla Creek, Persimmon Creek, Meyers Canyon and San Francisco Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sanderson, Dryden and Terrell County Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
